The oldest city in Pakistan is a topic of historical debate, with several cities laying claim to this title. Mohenjo-Daro is often considered one of the oldest cities in the world, dating back to around 2500 BCE as part of the ancient Indus Valley Civilization. However, historical references also point to Jalandhar and Multan, dating back to 100 AD, indicating their status as the oldest surviving cities in the Punjab region. Additionally, Peshawar has recorded history dating back to at least 539 BCE, making it one of the oldest cities in Pakistan and the world. This historical context provides a rich tapestry of ancient cities in the region, each with its own significance and contribution to the historical narrative of Pakistan.

However, the historical significance of Jalandhar, Multan, and Peshawar also adds to the rich historical tapestry of ancient cities in Pakistan.
